snippet: The decision leaves Saudi Arabia to decide on its own whether to influence prices by adjusting output before the next OPEC meeting in December.
abstract: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries leaves unchanged a ceiling for oil production at 30 million barrels daily, despite signs of a slowdown in the global economy and slumping oil prices; decision leaves Saudi Arabia to decide on its own whether to influence prices by adjusting output before the next OPEC meeting in December.

byline.contributor: Stanley Reed and Clifford Krauss contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The decision leaves Saudi Arabia to decide on its own whether to influence prices by adjusting output before the next OPEC meeting in December.

headline.main: Despite Price Drop, Oil Cartel Keeps Production Limit
headline.print_headline: Despite Price Drop, Oil Cartel Keeps Production Limit
